intro: Astragalus douglasii, commonly known as Douglas's milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils. Astragalus douglasii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
